channel.title: Frustrating on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Frustrating on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Accessibility Problem with Gilder/Levin Image Replacement Method
item.description: I have a friend who lives his life in low contrast. He is frequently the inspiration I need to go the extra mile and find an accessible solution to a programing quandary. A few weeks ago I had the good fortune to get to visit him and we cruised around the internet while drinking Rusty Nails so I could walk in his shoes for a bit. His computer is set up to use one of Windows XP’s high contrast colour schemes and he also makes use of IE’s ability to override a website’s CSS.

item.title: Finally figure out what my problem is.
item.description: I read John Resig’s article Sub-Pixel Problems in CSS a few days ago and found it to very useful information. And then today I had an “ah-ha’ moment - this this is why I hate coding flexible horizontal navigation menus.
